properties.description: Posted by Citycyclist

properties.name: A week in near paradise
properties.description: Posted by Citycyclist With my parents, sister and daughter, I spent a week here in a house overlooking the bay. The mosquitoes were a menace, but otherwise it was perfection.

properties.name: A year in England
properties.description: Posted by Citycyclist North Harrow, England1990s. Lived in this suburb northwest of London for a year, with my 6-year-old daughter. Spent most of our time traveling around England, Wales and Scotland. It\'s possible to drive from London to the Scottish Highlands in one day.

properties.name: Acropolis, Athens, Greece
properties.description: Posted by Citycyclist Athens, Greece2500-year-old home of the Parthenon, the Propylaea, the Erechtheum and the Temple of Athena Nike.

properties.name: Birding
properties.description: Posted by Citycyclist The Swallows, Amazons, D\'s and Captain Flint are sailing in the Outer Hebrides when Dick spots what he thinks is a pair of rare birds nesting on a loch. The rest of the tale is everyone\'s effort to head off the evil collector who wants to capture, kill and display the birds

properties.name: Bryggen, Norway
properties.description: Posted by Citycyclist Bergen, NorwayMy first taste of fjordland. Revisited with my parents in 2008 and spent a lovely day walking around the medieval parts of the town.

properties.name: Budapest
properties.description: Posted by Citycyclist Budapest has 3 sites on the list--the castle area, Andrasy Avenue, and the banks of the Danube. Lovely city.

properties.name: Canterbury Cathedral
properties.description: Posted by Citycyclist The history is palpable. I reread Chaucer after visiting this site.

properties.name: Carlsbad Caverns
properties.description: Posted by Citycyclist It\'s been nearly 50 years since I\'ve entered these caverns, and I still have dreams about them.

properties.name: Chatham, Cape Cod
properties.description: Posted by Citycyclist Weekend here with friends. Packed with cars, but still lovely, especially when away from the crowds of tourists.

properties.name: Childhood in Tulsa, Part I
properties.description: Posted by Citycyclist Lived here just a few years, after moving from Pryor. Very few memories--more of the neighborhood than of the house itself. Attended Hoover Elementary School through 3rd grade.

properties.name: Childhood in Tulsa, Part II
properties.description: Posted by Citycyclist Tulsa, OklahomaActually, this was the 4th or 5th house I lived in, but from 1961 to 1975, it was my home. Went to Phillips Elementary School, and then Edison Jr/Sr High School.

properties.name: City Cyclist
properties.description: Posted by CitycyclistNew York, NYI\'ll be cycling through soon.

properties.name: City of Bath
properties.description: Posted by Citycyclist Read Jane Austen\'s Persuasion before you go to Bath, then think of Jane herself, hating it here. Perhaps she didn\'t like all the crowds in the Pump Room.

properties.name: College years
properties.description: Posted by Citycyclist Four excellent years (not counting a term in London).

properties.name: Colorado Springs
properties.description: Posted by Citycyclist NYC to Co Springs to Tulsa to NYC. Round trip nearly 4000 miles, and I drove the whole thing, solo, in 6 days (not counting a one-day rest in Tulsa). My daughter is now in college in Co Springs. She loves it there.

properties.name: Coot Club
properties.description: Posted by Citycyclist Dick and Dorothea meet up with the Coot Club, learn to sail, and save some birds and some Hullabaloos.

properties.name: Dastardly deeds
properties.description: Posted by Citycyclist The D\'s help the Coot Club, victims of a plot to make them look guilty of loosing boats from their moors. They sail around the Broads, barely keeping ahead of foes. It all ends very satisfactorily.

properties.name: Delphi, Greece
properties.description: Posted by Citycyclist Delphi, GreeceRemote, peaceful, with views of the valley below.

properties.name: Farthest North (pre 2008)
properties.description: Posted by Citycyclist Narvik, NorwaySite of WWII battle. Arrived by boat, from Bodo. But now no longer my farthest north. See North Cape 2008.

properties.name: Farthest South
properties.description: Posted by Citycyclist Invercargill New Zealand1988. Jumping off point to Stewart Island, starting point for my cycling tour of the southern end of the South Island. Set off from here to Te Anau and points north.

properties.name: Favorite spot in all the world, possibly
properties.description: Posted by Citycyclist Grinton, EnglandTiny village, in Swaledale. Cycled through here a few times, stayed in youth hostel here, brought my mother, my daughter and my niece here. Would live here if I could.

properties.name: First hospital stay
properties.description: Posted by Citycyclist 1045 E. 100 s Salt lake city utah 84102This was formerly known as Holy Cross Hospital. I was born here in the early 1950s. Within 3 years my family had moved to Pryor, Oklahoma.

properties.name: Florence, Italy
properties.description: Posted by Citycyclist Florence, ItalyFull of tourists, but still gorgeous.

properties.name: Four corners, Part II
properties.description: Posted by Citycyclist san diego, californiaVisited family, attended a conference here

properties.name: Four corners, Part III
properties.description: Posted by Citycyclist Jacksonville Beach, floridaAttended a conference here, with friends; drove to old town of St. Augustine.

properties.name: Four corners, Part IV
properties.description: Posted by Citycyclist I-95, MaineRoad trip with my daughter and her friend, en route to Canada

properties.name: Four corners, part I
properties.description: Posted by Citycyclist seattle, washingtonVisited friends and family here.

properties.name: Gold mining
properties.description: Posted by Citycyclist Swallows, Amazons, and D\'s form a mining company to search for gold on the High Topps. They fight off claim jumpers as well as a wild fire.

properties.name: Graz
properties.description: Posted by Citycyclist Lovely views in both directions. So many places I wish I could have stopped to enjoy the views.

properties.name: Graz
properties.description: Posted by Citycyclist Lovely city, with modern works (such as the ocarina-like modern art museum) nestled among historic buildings.

properties.name: Greenwich
properties.description: Posted by Citycyclist December 2006. A cold day, including a hike through the tunnel under the Thames from the Isle of Dogs. Fab views of London.

properties.name: Hiding from the Great Aunt
properties.description: Posted by Citycyclist The Great Aunt\'s sudden arrival at the home of the Amazons forces the D\'s to camp out on their own, remaining hidden from her and risking getting the entire neighborhood into trouble.

properties.name: Historic Center of Vienna, Austria
properties.description: Posted by Citycyclist Vienna, AustriaMusical capitol of Europe, with castles, gardens, and other historic buildings, including the Stephansdom.

properties.name: Köln Cathedral, Germany
properties.description: Posted by Citycyclist Koln Cathedral, GermanyMagnificent cathedral. Miraculously survived WWII bombings.

properties.name: Liana bridge
properties.description: Posted by Citycyclist Crossed a vine bridge while hiking to famous falls at Poubara

properties.name: Madrid
properties.description: Posted by Citycyclist Met her group here, for bus to Salamanca. Came back a few times, to visit El Prado.

properties.name: Mesa Verde National Park
properties.description: Posted by Citycyclist Spent a few days here with my parents and daughter in 1997. Petroglyphs and cliff dwellings. Astonishing.

properties.name: Mont-Saint-Michel
properties.description: Posted by Citycyclist Mont-Saint-Michel, FranceAnother one of those must-visit places, and well worth it.

properties.name: My 21st birthday
properties.description: Posted by Citycyclist Thessaloniki, GreeceTraveling through Europe in the early 1970s, passed through here on my way to Delphi, Athens, and Crete. Spent my birthday drinking ouzo in a taverna. Did not get drunk, just happy.

properties.name: My apartment
properties.description: Posted by Citycyclist 454 Ft Washington Ave 10033

properties.name: My first century
properties.description: Posted by Citycyclist Montauk, New York100+ miles from NYC to the lighthouse at Montauk Point State Park. Cycled this in one day (when I was much younger). Started out at 5 am, finished before dark.

properties.name: My neighborhood for 20 years
properties.description: Posted by Citycyclist New York, New York 10033Great mix of many cultures--Dominican, Greek, Orthodox Jew, Russian. North of the GWBridge and yet not too far from the rest of Manhattan. A great place to raise a kid.

properties.name: New York City
properties.description: Posted by Citycyclist 454 Ft Washington AveJust two days here to regroup from college, then off to Englad.

properties.name: North Cape--Farthest North 2008
properties.description: Posted by Citycyclist

properties.name: North Pole
properties.description: Posted by Citycyclist One of the Amazons is in quarantine with mumps; the others meet Dorothea and Dick (the D\'s) for adventures in an igloo and in learning semaphore while they wait for the lake to freeze and for the end of the quarantine. The story ends with a desperate race in a blizzard, to see who is first to the Pole.

properties.name: North Rim, Grand Canyon
properties.description: Posted by Citycyclist Visited twice, both with my family. So indescribably majestic.

properties.name: Old Town of Avila, Spain
properties.description: Posted by Citycyclist Avila, SpainBirthplace of St. Teresa.

properties.name: Old Town of Cáceres, Spain
properties.description: Posted by Citycyclist Cáceres, SpainMixture of Roman, Islamic and European architecture in this historic town.

properties.name: Old Town of Lunenburg, Nova Scotia, Canada
properties.description: Posted by Citycyclist Lunenburg, Nova Scotia, CanadaFishing wharf, museum, seafood. Tour a fishing boat.

properties.name: Old Town of Segovia, Spain
properties.description: Posted by Citycyclist Segovia, SpainWell-preserved Roman aqueduct towers over center of old town.

properties.name: Old and New Towns of Edinburgh
properties.description: Posted by Citycyclist Climbed to Arthur\'s Seat, walked the Royal Mile (and saw the Heart of Midlothian--of minor historical importance), and watched a highland fling on a cold weekend in this lovely town.

properties.name: Oops!
properties.description: Posted by Citycyclist While anchored near Harwich, the Swallows slip their mooring in a fog and drift out to see, then manage to survive a storm and sail to Holland. For me, this is the scariest book of the series, because for the first time there are no adults nearby to help out.

properties.name: Palace of Schönbrunn, Austria
properties.description: Posted by Citycyclist Palace of Schönbrunn, AustriaFormer summer residence of the Austrian royal familiy.

properties.name: Parc W, Niger
properties.description: Posted by Citycyclist Parc W, southwest NigerBaboons, antelope, and other wild creatures. A long ride from Niamey, but worth it.

properties.name: Paris, Banks of the Seine
properties.description: Posted by Citycyclist Paris, FranceA walk along here can take you through centuries of history, with the Eiffel Tower and the spire of Notre Dame as backdrop. And don\'t forget Gene Kelly and Leslie Caron in "American in Paris", or Cary Grant and Audrey Hepburn in "Charade"--a romantic spot indeed.

properties.name: Peace Corps Posting
properties.description: Posted by Citycyclist Booue, Gabon1970s. Taught English in Booue, a village near the Ogooue River. A plane came twice a week; road traffic was intermittent (especially during the rainy season). And yet, not really lonely. Thank heavens for BBC World Service and an excellent radio.

properties.name: Piazza del Duomo, Pisa, Italy
properties.description: Posted by Citycyclist Pisa, ItalyHelped a fellow traveler with a fear of heights get to the top of the Leaning Tower (the campanile)

properties.name: Pilgrim's Path
properties.description: Posted by Citycyclist Croagh Patrick, IrelandHiked to shrine at top.

properties.name: Pueblo de Taos
properties.description: Posted by Citycyclist 1997, with parents and daughter. Grateful for the opportunity to explore something older than almost any structure in Europe.

properties.name: Roman ruins at Mérida, Spain
properties.description: Posted by Citycyclist Mérida, SpainRoman ruins from 2000 years ago.

properties.name: Saint-Emilion, France
properties.description: Posted by Citycyclist Saint-Emilion, FranceImportant wine area, near Bordeaux.

properties.name: Salzburg
properties.description: Posted by Citycyclist I skipped the 4-hours Sound of Music Tour and just wandered the streets on my own. Mozart everywhere!

properties.name: Samantha's House
properties.description: Posted by Citycyclist 29 College Hill RoadLulu\'s base, as she explored London\'s museums for a few days before heading to Spain.

properties.name: Samantha's house
properties.description: Posted by Citycyclist Just a few days here, while exploring London. Then off to Heathrow, to fly to Madrid.

properties.name: Samantha's house
properties.description: Posted by Citycyclist Harrow WealdLulu\'s base as she explored London at the end of May.

properties.name: Secret Water
properties.description: Posted by Citycyclist Swallows and Amazons unite to explore and map uncharted territories by sail and by foot, with the aid of eels and mastodons.

properties.name: Sedona, Arizona
properties.description: Posted by Citycyclist Sedona, ArizonaFamily reunion, in and around fantastic red rock formations and several vortices. Wildfires to the north of us, in Oak Creek Canyon, thunderstorms passing through each day (it\'s also "monsoon season"), hot, Hot, HOT, and way too much good food. In other words, a perfect week away from NYC.

properties.name: Seville, Spain
properties.description: Posted by Citycyclist Seville, SpainCastle, cathedral (with Columbus\' tomb), and archives from new world colonies.

properties.name: Statue of Liberty
properties.description: Posted by Citycyclist Statue of Liberty, New York1976. Bicentennial. Climbed to top on a HOT day, but the view from the crown was worth it.

properties.name: Stonehenge, Avebury and Associated Sites
properties.description: Posted by Citycyclist Stonehenge, EnglandI first saw Stonehenge in 1975 and have been back often. It\'s always impressive; when you drive out from London, or up from Salisbury, it appears just as you reach the top of a hill, perfectly placed to impress. Avebury is different, with houses so near, the stones are practically in someone\'s backyard.

properties.name: Studley Royal Park including the Ruins of Fountains Abbey
properties.description: Posted by Citycyclist The Abbey and Studley Royal Garden are always gorgeous, no matter the season or weather. Viewing the snow-covered ruins on a wintry day makes the life the monks led here, so long ago, almost imaginable. So cold, so isolated, so quiet, despite their extreme wealth. I walked into the Serpentine Tunnel in Studley Royal with friends and two 6-year-old girls, and we were petrified by what sounded like a monster coming at us from the other end. We ran out and waited to find out what it was--two large bulldogs on leashes, panting as they dragged their owners along.

properties.name: Swallowdale
properties.description: Posted by Citycyclist While the Swallows\' ship is in port for repairs (after being stove in), they camp in a hidden dale. The Amazons, meanwhile, are captives of a strict Great Aunt.

properties.name: Te Wahipounamu – South West New Zealand
properties.description: Posted by Citycyclist During a one-month cycling trip of the South Island, I took a day-trip by bus here (the tunnel was beyond my cycling nerves), and managed to squeeze in a short boat ride in Milford Sound. In the parking lot, takahes were chewing the rubber bits of windshield wipers, ignoring the tourists photographing them. This was the moment I wished for a camera, but I was traveling light on this trip, and these were pre-digital days. Mount Cook (Aoraki) is also considered part of this area, and I was there as well. (Lovely Youth Hostels in Te Anau and Mt Cook; between Invercargill and Te Anau, I stayed in a shearer\'s hut on a sheep station at Blackmount.)

properties.name: Tenting Tonight
properties.description: Posted by Citycyclist Badlands Natl Park, South DakotaBadlands National Park--great camp ground, if you don\'t mind close neighbors. Hot as blazes during the day, but lovely at night. Spent the night watching an electrical storm with my daughter.

properties.name: The Alhambra, Granada, Spain
properties.description: Posted by Citycyclist Granada, SpainWell-known for the Moorish influence on the architecture.

properties.name: Toledo, Spain
properties.description: Posted by Citycyclist Toledo, SpainEver since seeing El Greco\'s painting, I\'ve wanted to visit this town.

properties.name: Tower of London
properties.description: Posted by Citycyclist Took my five-year-old daughter here in the mid-1990s, where we found a great game based on stealing the crown jewels.

properties.name: Venice, Italy
properties.description: Posted by Citycyclist Venice, ItalyYou know all about it already. Don\'t miss the Bridge of Sighs.

properties.name: Vienna
properties.description: Posted by Citycyclist Taught a two-week course here in 2002, and again in 2009.

properties.name: West Norwegian Fjords
properties.description: Posted by Citycyclist Hurtigruten to the furthest end of Geirangerfjord, then a bus over the Eagle Pass and Trollstigen, to Molde.

properties.name: Wild Cat Island
properties.description: Posted by Citycyclist Here the Swallows first cross paths with the Amazons and Captain Flint, the start of the series. Camping and sailing galore!

properties.name: Works of Antoni Gaudi
properties.description: Posted by Citycyclist Gaudi\'s Cathedral and Parc Guell a must-see for anyone visiting Barcelona.
